title: On partial derivatives of some summatory functions
abstract:
Let $f$ be a real arithmetic function and let $g:[1,\infty[\to{\mathbb R}$ be
a smooth function. We describe two emblematic instances in which saddle-point
estimates may be used to evaluate the frequency, on the set of integers
$n\leqslant x$, of the event $\{f(n)\leqslant g(n)\}$ from those relevant to
the event $\{f(n)\leqslant y\}$. The first example revisits Dickman's
historical contribution to the theory of friable integers. The second is
concerned with the distribution of the squarefree kernel of an integer.
